snippet: The Charoen Pokphand Group of Thailand said on Friday that it had the resources to complete its planned $9.4 billion acquisition of shares in Ping An Insurance of China, disputing reports that its deal with the British bank HSBC was in jeopardy.
abstract: The Charoen Pokphand Group of Thailand said on Friday that it had the resources to complete its planned $9.4 billion acquisition of shares in Ping An Insurance of China, disputing reports that its deal with the British bank HSBC was in jeopardy.

headline.main: Thai Buyer Contends Ping An Sale Is on Track
headline.print_headline: Bidder Denies Hitch With Purchase of Ping An Stake
